snippet: The defense and prosecution in the case of Kenneth L. Miller, the leader of an Amish-Mennonite church, disputed whether he knew it was illegal to help a mother flee the country in a custody battle.
abstract: Prosecution and defense begin testimony in the case of Kenneth L Miller, the leader of an Amish-Mennonite church leader who is accused of helping Lisa Miller flee the country with her 7-year-old daughter in 2009 to evade the girl’s court-ordered visits with Ms Miller's former same-sex spouse; arguments focus on whether Kenneth Miller knew that his actions were illegal.
lead_paragraph: The defense and prosecution in the case of Kenneth L. Miller, the leader of an Amish-Mennonite church, disputed whether he knew it was illegal to help a mother flee the country in a custody battle.

headline.seo: Opposing Sides Preview Strategies in Trial of Kenneth Miller
headline.main: Opposing Sides Preview Strategies in Kidnapping Trial
headline.print_headline: Opposing Sides Preview Strategy in Kidnapping Trial

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
